final_answer: The image uses humor and satire by comparing two different appearances of the same person, one in a fashionable outfit and the other in underwear. The text "YES, BUT" adds a humorous twist, suggesting that while the person can present a stylish exterior ("YES"), there's a contrasting reality underneath ("BUT"). This could be a commentary on appearances versus reality, or how people often look different when stripped of outward embellishments. The visible tattoos in both panels add to the continuity and contrast, reinforcing the idea of changing perceptions with context.
